Project.description: An open-source application to test, showcase, and share all the best practices related to Next.js and React.

Footer.footnote: Made by <twitter></twitter>. Hosted on <vercel>Vercel</vercel>. Illustrations by <popsy>Popsy</popsy>. Source code available on <github>GitHub</github>.

Hero.heading: An open-source app showcasing the best of Next.js 14
Hero.sub-heading: I'm building a fully open-source web app with Next.js 14. Follow the development on Twitter as we explore and learn together.

Features.heading: Features
Features.sub-heading: This is an experimental project. Together, we'll build a modern web app with all the new and advanced features of Next.js 14.

NextJS.title: Next.js 14
NextJS.description: App dir, Routing, Layouts, Loading UI, and API routes.

React18.title: React 18
React18.description: Server and Client Components. Hooks and Suspense.

Components.title: Components
Components.description: UI components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS.

Subscriptions.title: Subscriptions
Subscriptions.description: FREE and PRO plans with Stripe.

Features.footnote: Taxonomy also includes a blog and a comprehensive documentation system, built using Contentlayer and MDX.

OpenSource.heading: Proudly Open Source
OpenSource.sub-heading: Taxonomy is fully open-source. The source code is available on <github>GitHub</github>.

UI.heading: Simple and Transparent Pricing
UI.sub-heading: Unlock all features including unlimited posts for your blog.

ProPlan.heading: What's included in the PRO plan

UI.foot-note: Taxonomy is just a demo. <bold>You can safely switch to PRO and you will not be charged anything.</bold>
